About

Hi, I’m Kıvanç - a Toronto-based sound designer. Over the years, my path in audio has taken me through a range of roles and disciplines. With degrees in Jazz and Sonic Arts, my background spans from arranging jazz to designing interactive music systems for games.

I create stylistically accurate and technically well-structured audio tailored to each game’s needs. I’ve worked as the full-time audio department for two game studios and continue to collaborate on projects as a freelance sound designer. The games I’ve worked on have explored themes ranging from sci-fi and medieval worlds to farming, house decoration, and even vampires.

If you’d like to learn more about my experience or get in touch, feel free to reach out.

Services

Best sound designer ever.

Sound Effects Design

I design and produce well tailored sound effects for games.

Middleware Integration

I integrate middleware solutions to enhance game audio and performance.

Music Composition

I compose and produce original music for games and interactive media.

Dreams ASD

One of my past projects, Beatpunk, explored the intersection of gameplay and music composition. It was a bullet heaven game built around a 4-bar looping synthwave structure, where guitar, synth, drums, and bass were divided into two-beat musical samples written in D minor. As players gained experience, they activated these musical layers in real time - effectively composing the soundtrack through gameplay. Each musical element was tied to abilities, and as the track evolved, the character's attacks evolved with it. The result was a system where music wasn't just background - it was the combat system.

  • Developer: Start Bootstrap
  • Service: Web Development
  • Date: April 2014
